title: Sinner returns from doping ban at Italian Open
description: Jannik Sinner is returning from a doping ban at the Italian Open.

title: 'I have some gas left in the tank': At 37, Djokovic still has big tennis goals
description: Djokovic has had a rough start to 2025, but shown flashes of brilliance too. And he's aiming for that 100th tour win.
author: Simon Cambers

title: Unlock the Perfect Slice Serve - Essential Tennis Podcast #415
description: The wide slice serve is a CRITICAL tool to have in your tool box. It pulls opponents out of position, opens the court up for you to hit into, exposes their usually weaker backhand side, and forces them to run twice as far for the next shot - if they even get it at all. Let’s take a deep dive into how YOU can develop this powerful weapon, step by step in this special episode of the Essential Tennis Podcast.
author: Essential Tennis LLC

title: 3 Djokovic Secrets To Winning More Matches - Essential Tennis Podcast #414
description: In this special episode of the Essential Tennis Podcast, you're going to learn the top 3 tactical secrets of Novak Djokovic that you can apply in your very next match. Use these tools to gain precision, consistency, and offense to make your opponents more uncomfortable, win more points, and win more matches.
author: Essential Tennis LLC

title: What is the Rome tennis schedule?
description: The men's semi-finals at the Internazionali BNL d’Italia will take place on Friday in Rome. Carlos Alcaraz and Lorenzo Musetti meet in a blockbuster rematch of their Monte-Carlo final. World No. 1 Jannik Sinner faces Tommy Paul. View Friday's full order of play below. ORDER OF PLAY - FRIDAY, 16 MAY 2025 Campo Centrale - start 13:30 WTA - [6] Mirra Andreeva / Diana Shnaider vs [3] Sara Errani (ITA) / Jasmine Paolini (ITA) Not Before 15:30 ATP - [3] Carlos Alcaraz (ESP) vs [8] Lorenzo Musetti (ITA) Not Before 19:00 WTA - Veronika Kudermetova / Elise Mertens (BEL) vs Storm Hunter (AUS) / Ellen Perez (AUS) Not Before 20:30 ATP - [1] Jannik Sinner (ITA) vs [11] Tommy Paul (USA) Pietrangeli - start 13:30 ATP - [Alt] Guido Andreozzi (ARG) / Theo Arribage (FRA) vs [2] Harri Heliovaara (FIN) / Henry Patten (GBR) ATP - Sadio Doumbia (FRA) / Fabien Reboul (FRA) vs [3] Kevin Krawietz (GER) / Tim Puetz (GER) [NEWSLETTER FORM]

title: What were the Rome tennis results?
description: Two of the Internazionali BNL d'Italia quarter-finals took place Thursday, when Jannik Sinner defeated Casper Ruud for the loss of just one game and Tommy Paul ousted Hubert Hurkacz to return to the Rome semi-finals. View all the Rome tennis results from Thursday below. Results - Thursday, 15 May 2025 Men's Singles - Quarterfinal ATP - [11] Tommy Paul (USA) d [30] Hubert Hurkacz (POL) 76(4) 63 ATP - [1] Jannik Sinner (ITA) d [6] Casper Ruud (NOR) 60 61 Men's Doubles - Quarterfinal ATP - Joe Salisbury (GBR)/Neal Skupski (GBR) d [4] Marcel Granollers (ESP)/Horacio Zeballos (ARG) 63 62 ATP - [1] Marcelo Arevalo (ESA)/Mate Pavic (CRO) d [7] Christian Harrison (USA)/Evan King (USA) 75 64 Women's Singles WTA - [6] Jasmine Paolini (ITA) d Peyton Stearns (USA) 75 61 Women's Doubles WTA - Storm Hunter (AUS)/Ellen Perez (AUS) d Ulrikke Eikeri (NOR)/Eri Hozumi (JPN) 46 62 10-5 WTA - Veronika Kudermetova/Elise Mertens (BEL) d \[8] Asia Muhammad (USA)/Demi Schuurs (NED) 36 62 10-4 [NEWSLETTER FORM]

title: Paul sets up Sinner semi-final after truck repossessed
description: Tommy Paul says he has been "grinding" to reclaim his repossessed truck after reaching the semi-finals of the Italian Open, where he will face Jannik Sinner.

title: Home favourite Paolini chases history against Gauff in Italian Open final
description: Italy's Jasmine Paolini will meet American Coco Gauff in the final of the Italian Open.

title: Italian Open 2025 Day 9 Quarter Final Recap
description: Day 9 at the Internazionali BNL d’Italia saw the top half of the draw in last eight eight action with the two remaining quarter finals completed. Top seed Jannik Sinner produced a 6-0, 6-1 demolition of Madrid champion Casper Ruud in just 64 minutes, showcasing why he’s the man to beat on Campo Centrale. The …
author: Jonathan

title: Italian Open 2025 Day 8 Quarter Final Recap
description: On day eight at the Foro Italico, the bottom half of the draw played their quarter-final matches with Carlos Alcaraz seeing off Jack Draper, and Lorenzo Musetti taking out defending champion Alexander Zverev. Both matches had similarities but different outcomes. Alcaraz wobbled but pulled through with a strong finish, whereas Zverev wobbled and never recovered, …
author: Jonathan
